text: Gaaah! Another petty challenge! If the Crow God wants a fight with me, I give him a fight!
A strange smell in the air… poison?
The Crow uses cheap tricks, but they won’t work on me! Today I dine on his puppets!
Gangly fool over there is champion of the Eagle God. Look at him panic! He tries to summon more of the Eagle’s puppets,
but he’ll never have enough to defeat the Troll King! He summons them only for us to kill, for me to eat!
They will all know I am the Lord of the Monster Horde!
Mmm slave of the Hound God is here for a fight! The fool tries to make prey out of a predator! Does he know he fights a king?
Not like the weak man-kings of the south. I eat those kings for breakfast! Time to feast!!!
My twisted army, you all follow the Troll King! And you know that where the Troll King goes, death follows!
The Serpents over there challenge me because their master is scared - scared of me!
No magic will save them! I'll hammer their champion into a bloody meat patty before I eat him!
Gaaaah! Beardy man over there has my crown! Stunty-runt dares steal from me!
Doesn’t the stupid little man know he steals from royalty? When I catch him, I’m taking my crown back,
and he'll be the first royal meal for the new king of the world - me! Monsters and madmen all - let’s have their guts for lunch!
What a compliment! Although the other Ruinous Ones show us no favour, they at least grant us recognition! The followers of the Crow dare stand before us as an affront to our Master.
We have shunned their God, and for that they consider us a threat - and so they should!
Our victories prove the Master’s dominance! Now we will show them what a threat we really are – we shall drown them in their own blood and guts! Glory to the Master!!!
Look at that despicable cabal of Eagle God worshippers across the way, with their craven champion! I fear no champion, I only destroy them!
And you, the warriors and twisted beasts of my army, have slain many with me in the name of our Dark Master.
Make no mistake - he still watches us!
May the bodies continue to fall! May their limbs be torn from their torsos! May the battlefield be soaked red with their blood!!!
The bodies of enemies slain have paved a bloody path, drenched in gore, by the will of our master; the trail has led us here today!
Now the tidal wave of blood we've spilt has drawn the attention of the Hound’s twisted followers. They stand across the way with their weakling champion,
attempting to summon yet more cretins. I will take his skull, and together we will wipe out every one of them! To the slaughter!!!
Fellow raiders! Together we have destroyed realms, torn down the feeble cities of the weak, and proven ourselves worthy, worthy in the eyes of our Master.
We have the attention of the other Gods; they feel threatened by us! And what a dark blessing it is! It is proof of the Master's favour!
Look at the Serpent-followers... those sensation-seekers and self-obsessed cowards!
They stand trembling over there with their champion, still trying to summon more help. Let’s make their corpses a bloody offering of our own!!!
Tribesmen, again it is time to soak our blades in the blood of weak southerners!
Pompous and proud, yet they don’t even give me the courtesy of a worthy fight. I come here seeking champions, but look – they send peasants!
Their cowardly Lords don’t deserve their riches, so we shall kill them and take all that we see.
Then, the rest of Bretonnia! My Masters will receive these offerings by my sword! Kill at will!!!
Once more the Bastion is under attack, once more the honour of its defence falls to me. I will not let you down, father!
They offer only disharmony and darkness, while I bring order and light. Together we shall defend these walls, sell our lives if we must. Ready your weapons!
Perhaps one day the Great Bastion will fall, but not this day. No, it is the forces of disharmony that shall fall – to our blades!
My father, the Celestial Dragon Emperor, watches us! Defend the bastion under his gaze, and you will find his favour! Strength and honour is yours to take!
The Ruinous Powers knock upon our gates, but these guests are not welcome! Send them from our threshold with the steel in your hands and in your hearts!
If my sister is found delinquent in her duty, then we defend the Bastion, and ensure the invading scum shall not set foot in my parent's domain!
Mother has forewarned me… Chaos attempts to breach the Bastion, and so I bring the might of the Western Provinces to thwart them! Ready your arms!
The Dark Powers assault my father's walls, but it is mother who tasks me to clear them of filth! So it shall be, for I am Zhao Ming!
Ah, the Great Bastion! I should be its master, let me prove to my parents why. Ready your weapons, my followers, purge the walls of Chaos!
Chaos comes. But we will not be found wanting. Defend this place and earn me honour, for that is your role in this pantomime!
Cease your squeaking and groom yourselves for battle, rodents of Clan Rictus, for the enemy come into sight!
The green no-furs sit upwind, unaware of our approach! Look-see how the block-headed fools send their patrols away! A-ha-ha!
Lucky-us, yes-yes! We attack while they are weak! We leave only their bones, ha-ha!
Press ESC to continue
New Objective
New Topic
Scribe-slave squeaks wise words-noises!
Clan Rictus now-now most powerful, under Horned Rat I will be more than mere Chief of Deep Warrens, even better-superior title, yes-yes!
Forward rodents of Rictus: the Elf-thing island ours, Vortex OURS!
*Meeker* (Let me just go and take a look-strategise from this vantage point far-far over here…)
So, the "Great Settra" sends his champion to thwart my course, does he?
Perhaps he thinks me some princeling, to be swatted aside by such an inferior.
Better you had come yourself, Settra! The Staff of Nagash will be mine, and your servant's head will be returned on a spike! Haaah!
Come, loyal thralls! Today, we do Nagash's work.
This pathetic rabble of reptiles presume to master the arts of resurrection!
Their pitiful knowledge of such matters will die with them, here before the statues of the gods!
Slay them all! Bring me Alcadizaar's remains! My Tomb Blade will burn with the light of Nagash!
Since time out of mind, the Vampire thralls of my warped cousin have blighted Nehekhara.
Today, we burn out that blight. Hear me, O Asaph! This slaughter I offer in your name!
May your venom flow in the sacred staff, that I may shatter your adversaries for all eternity!
The followers of Nagash have woven a web of deceit designed to entrap me, like a Tomb Scorpion waiting under the sands for prey…
But I am no quarry! Let these bestial fleshlings come!
They will witness sand and stone, they shall see the true might of the Mortuary Cult; the true masters of Undeath, the Liches of Khemri!
I alone may wield the Blessed Blade of Ptra. For am I not his right-hand, the Bringer of the Fires of the Sun?
Today, I offer him a fine tribute indeed - a thousand souls or more, each an idolater, a heathen, and an enemy of Nehekhara.
May this please you, mighty Ptra, bringer of the day, for it is the last these unbelievers will ever see!
My master, your Black Pyramid is ready.
I do not claim this, I am merely its steward; a warden to keep your shrine ready for your inevitable resurrection
A necessary task, for even now the feeble Tomb Kings gather to steal your majesty!
Settra sends all Nehekhara against us, but with your staff in hand they are doomed to fail!
I care not for this Pyramid. Unlike others, it is not power I seek, but vengeance.
This is a tool, nothing more. It is a gift to Asaph, and in her name I shall hunt the whores of Lahmia!
So, my legions, banish this Liche King, he is in our way!
For too long the Mortuary Cult has fallen into the Arch-Necromancer’s shadow.
But Nagash has gone from this world, and if we claim the Black Pyramid we will ensure he can never return!
The lore within shall show us the true path to the Day of Awakening – now is the dawn of the Mortuary Cult!
Yes, yes! Banish the Liche King – we are exiles no longer!
The Black Pyramid rises. It is time for the Great King to ascend to a new throne.
But Arkhan attempts to frustrate me, proving finally that blind loyalty to a perished conjurer will be his doom.
Forward my legions, I will have Nagash’s pyramid – Settra dominates ALL!
Today we dispatch these faithless barbarians, these petty thieves, in tribute to Djaf, the God of War and Death.
He will feast as the jackal does and grow fat on their souls. For who dares stand before Settra in defiance of his will?
I am the King of Kings, the Imperishable. And I will see my crown returned!
Hear me Khaine, I dedicate all the following deaths to you. Give me your bloody hand so I may hold it and let it guide me to victory!
My retainers advise caution, but I am no coward... The first slash is the sweetest and I always strike first!
Fine! Let Malekith have the Vortex!
He will forever be in my debt and such mundane power does not interest me.
But I will take the murder of all the ratmen and the slaying of their Horned God.
That will be mine – and I dedicate it all to Khaine! Let the slaughter begin!
I feel the pain of those within the Vortex.
The torment of Caledor Dragontamer as he and his brothers wrestle to keep Ulthuan afloat.
We will aid them – salve their woes and stop this rat-god from entering the world!
Asur to your queen! Defend the Vortex!
Silence, my sisters! We work covertly. As Isha looks from upon high so shall we look down on these mortal puppets by taking the higher ground.
Then we shall slay them all bar one. I will look in the eye of this last surviving foe and he will not bear falsehood. He will tell me how to lift the curse on Avelorn's star.
Now, away, my host! Begin the toil!
The Loremaster speaks truth. There is a cancer at the heart of Ulthuan.
And if it is not halted, the fate of all Asur will match Nagarythe.
We cannot let Ulthuan be consumed in sea and shadow. We must stop this vermin-god at all costs.
Follow me loyal kin, now is our final fate – glory or defeat!
The Druchii scum seek to trap us. The fools think it is easy to snare the shadows! Disabuse them of this notion.
We shall show these followers of the weak-willed brat; the mummy’s boy that couldn’t even tame a candle flame in the shrine of Asuryan!
I need to fill my quiver, then the Moonbow can sing again – so let these Druchii mongrels come!
My father calls, not this Norse puppet who claims ownership simply because he spilt his seed…
No, my real sire… the Seafather! Let the forces of the false begetter crash uselessly against the cliffs, like waves against the Swordfysh's hull!
Cutlasses out! Blood and salt!
Ahhhhhhhhhhhhh… what joy do these gleaming spear-wielders bring, for now there is a chance for me to sing, and then they shall escort to their seafaring king…
But before then, I’ll have to be crass and make these unfortunate souls stare at my looking glass.
Ahhhhhhhhhhhhh… whom do I spy, whom do I see? It is the glorious, doomed Knights of Chivalry.
For these unfortunate souls shall not get a pass as I force them gaze into my looking glass!
Steady, my Corsairs, the Skaven come - they think to board my tower in secret, but no creature steps upon the Blessed Dread without my knowing.
The rodent-sorcerer sends his minions, but this is no sinking ship. No rats are welcome here!
Be merciless! The Kraken rumbles. My helm thirsts for the power it lacks, and these vermin filth will quench it.
Your hunt is over. The Merwyrm is not yours to slay. It is a creature of Mathlann, Lord of the Deeps, and only I am charged to cull in His name.
It has been amusing watching your sea-wracked corpses stumble and dodder as you tracked the prey, but Amanar is Lothern’s guardian, a creature aligned to the Asur.
Who are you to interfere in such an ancient rivalry? The prize is mine and mine alone!
The beast is summoned, your use is at an end!
Prepare to face the Krakenlord!
That mob of reptilian scoundrels travelled far for their precious gold… it must be important…
What are they hiding? What secrets does it contain? The Winds of Magic have shunned me for too long, my thoughts constantly at odds with one another.
All the while, those bulbous Slann toad-priests conjure great spells for their futile causes.
Now they hide behind a glyph-enchanted tower. I must reconnect with my powers… I must silence the voices in my head!
Forward, deckhands! Bring me that Slann Gold, or I’ll send you back to your watery graves!
The peons of the Empire dare lay their hands on the chest I seek!
These cattle are ignorant of what they now possess, but they will not live long enough to find out!
Roth’s Moondial cannot elude me any longer. It is only a matter of time before another rival uses it to gain access to the Galleon’s Graveyard.
Only I, Count Noctilus, am worthy of the Maelstrom’s boundless power!
Only I can rule the Great Ocean and the waters beyond!
The Vortex lies at the heart of Ulthuan. It interests me little.
Let Malekith have it, for he has promised me Ulthuan’s coasts!
And when they sink, I have been commissioned to collect and enslave all Asur hiding in their precious colonies. The spoils and infamy will be legendary!
So, my crew, dispose of this vermin and their god. For riches and murder await!
Anchor the tides and slow the moons,\\nbreak the waves and tame the sea!
The monster hunts and the prey will shiver,\\nsince the Vortex went a-quiver!
The beast cares not if you're living or dead,\\ninto its belly is where you'll head!
Lord Kroak will be an invaluable ally in the fulfilment of the Great Plan, but his worldly relics are in imminent danger.
The Skaven approach, Kroq-Gar. Prepare yourself!
The Skaven approach, revered master. Prepare yourself!
The Skaven approach, mighty Prophet. Prepare yourself!
The Skaven approach, Master of Skies. Prepare yourself!
While Kroak’s forcefield provides him with some protection, the awakening process leaves him vulnerable to attack.
It is imperative that you defend him until he has fully risen from his slumber!
The time is upon us, apostles! It has been foretold!
The Rodent-God’s pestilent spawn blights our kind, but today the Red Crested Skinks shall strike a vengeful blow.
We shall send these plague-beasts to the bottom of the pit, where the Great Serpent's wrath awaits them!
With this glorious sacrifice, Skaven-kind will know that the Prophecy of Sotek has come to pass!
Yes, brave apostles! You follow the divine instrument of the Great Serpent!
Together we have answered our calling to cast the pestilent rat-spawn into oblivion.
And we must continue to do so, now more than ever!
For the consummation of the great Skaven manipulation is at hand.
We shall stop their abhorrent rat-god from entering this realm. The power of Sotek compels us!
The Skaven defile those temple ruins, disrupting the Geomantic Web here.
For reasons I cannot see, this disruption also weakens my Mask of Heavens.
Our mission is clear.
Purge these plague-beasts from the area, end their contradiction of our master’s will!
Braves, bring wrath from the sky!!!
Those plague-beasts attempt to summon their daemon into this world.
I sense the Great Plan will be in dire risk.
It is my sacred duty as Master of Skies to uphold the will of the Old Ones.
Braves of the ground and sky, follow and we will finally banish the rat-spawn from this world once and for all!
Ikit has the biggest brain of all rats!
Hatched a simple-masterful scheme, yes-yes!
First - gather the fallen Warpstone, all the Warpstone!
Second - make all these stinking reptiles die-die.
Murder-death-kill devices at the ready!
Stupid Council-Seers think they can outsmart Chief Warlock Engineer of Skavenblight!
They want to sacrifice Skryre, but I make-make THEM the sacrifice.
Horned Rat will know WE are Skavendom rulers, not stupid Seers. Arm kill-systems!
Yes-good, Elf-things can help us warm up weapons for sacrificing!
All-all-die! My intellect makes Skryre strongest of all clans!
The death of innocent settlers cannot go unanswered, huntsmen!
These unrelenting reptile-monsters must be made to pay, lest they keep coming back.
Make no mistake – these cold-blooded abominations are not just mindless beasts.
They are intelligent… intelligent enough to know the meaning of vengeance.
And now, with our arrows and blades, we will make them feel it.
Listen up, huntsmen! Too many good men have fallen to this abominable lizard and its savage attendants. Too many innocent settlers mauled to death and devoured. But no more!
The so-called “Spirit of the Jungle” is no ghost. It is a thing of flesh and blood, just like the others of its monstrous kind that we have already seen and slain. It can be killed!
I know you are afraid. But remember, fear is not a weakness. It will keep you as sharp as the weapons that you wield. It will keep you alive.
Today, civilisation will triumph over the dark wilderness. Man shall triumph over beast!
The masters have brought me here to fulfil my purpose.
Rat-spawn’s Daemon comes now. An abomination to this world and the Great Plan.
I have resisted great foes many times – and today, once again.
Gor-Rok readily takes on more scars to fulfil the will of the Old Ones!
Lustria’s scourge are at Itza’s gates.
The dead-spawn filth of the Great Pond seek the Old Ones' treasures.
The rat-spawn also come. The temple-city must not fall.
I will fight at the front, without fear. Without pain!
Itza in danger.
Must not fall.
Death to dead-spawn!
Ancient power here.
Nakai feels. Nakai remembers.
Daemon-spawn want artefact.
They will die!
Warmbloods take lands.
Warmbloods take artefacts.
Nakai cannot allow.
Warmbloods die now!
Warriors of Lyonesse, behold! Even here, the Lady watches over the brave and the righteous. The signs are clear.
Just as in Couronne, when we rode forth to vanquish the evil that threatened to overcome it, we must do so again.
The beleaguered Dwarfs need our help, and now. Like us, they fight against the Undead horrors of this land to rid it of its taint.
The Lady compels us to lend our hands to this noble fight. Chevaliers, Charge!!!
Hear me, brothers! These foul foes of the ocean seek to ravage our homeland, to plunder it of the riches of our honourable lords.
I may have been born a peasant, but it has been my life’s purpose to ensure that men of the righteous and good – whether rich or poor – triumph over evil in all forms.
I fear no evil, for I am guided by the Lady's divine will. She watches over me and shows me the way.
Just as my faith in her guides me and gives me strength, have faith in me, and I shall do the same for you.
To battle, Chevaliers!
Hear me, brothers! The foul, Undead kings of these lands want to see the world bow to the dark shroud of their rule. This greatly offends the Lady!
I may have been born a peasant, but it has been my life’s purpose to ensure that men of the righteous and good triumph over evil in all forms.
He who steal-takes my things will soon be cut-sliced into giblet-bits, yes-yes! Snikch always gets his mark!
Thief cower-hides with his ratling minions, thinks he-he can escape my attentions. No chance!
From the-the shadows, I will emerge. Ambush-slay his patrols first, make the thief easier to kill, yes-yes!
Finally, Nightlord’s mission will be complete, yes-yes. Druchii Elf-thing has what I came for.
And just in-in time! Long-limb no-fur tries to scurry-escape on his big black paddle-boat, back to Druchii home-nest.
Aaargh, Naggaroth too far, must finish this here-here and now-now!
The Daemon-power will be mine, I will cut-slice the Elf-thing open to-to get if I must.
No-nothing shall stop me, Weeping Blades will make quick work of him! Time to cut-cut and stab-stab!
The Chaos Wastes. A brutal and horrific place, but I am no stranger to these twisted lands. My past exploits have brought me to far worse realms.
The Warpsword hungers, and must be fed. Something here entices it greatly... Dark energies surge from the blade, more-so than when it tasted the blood of those pathetic, Chaos-crazed Beastmen.
Is it me who wields the sword or the sword that wields me? Tz'arkan would surely say it is neither…
But I do not depend on you, cursed Daemon! While I am still in control, the blade’s thirst will be sated. It will be empowered once more.
By the God of Murder, there is more than enough Chaos blood to spill here, and spill it I will!
Well, well, well… it appears my business here in the Southlands is not over. The rat-maniacs amass in much greater numbers this time. They really don’t want me to leave…
If I could rip you from my soul, Tz’arkan, I would gladly give you up to these beasts! If only things were so simple. My affliction will be dealt with soon anyway – the Witch King promises it.
I need only to get back to Naggaroth with this Black Ark’s cargo of scrolls. But first, I will end this here and now. The verminous menace cannot be allowed to follow me back to the Land of Chill.
The elusive Deathmaster is nearby – let him come. Should he get close, by Khaine’s cup I will cut him down along with the rest of his pathetic brood!
I’ve ‘ad enough chin waggin’ with this git. He’s been hidin’ out here, braggin’ ‘bout how big he is.
All just rumours, he’s nuffink! Look at his stoopid hat, he’s tryin’ ta make ‘imself look bigger.
He’ll be even shorter once I cut ‘im down ta size 'n’ take back my axe!
Da ladz been sayin’ dey seen some other gobbos skulkin’ round ‘ere too. Best keep our eyes open!
Guzzler’s gonna get guzzled! There’s only one king of da gobbos, 'n' dat’s ME!
Time to ‘ave us a right good ruckus! Da Elf-gits are hidin’ behind dem walls, but they won’t hold us back for long.
We’ll smash ‘em all to crumbly bits, da Doom Diver teamz will see to dat!
Last time I wos ‘ere, somefink in da tower blocked our magics it did, and I reckon they got some more surprises for us.
I don’t like da look of dem towers either. So we gots to send in da fodder first, see what da sneaky gits are up to.
If dat pointy-‘eaded boss shows up, I’ll ‘ave ‘im. This time Grom will show da world he really is da biggest and da strongest!
So it IS true! The Blood Dragon dons the lost heirloom of my bloodline. His minions may be many, but when he falls, his control will crumble, along with his shambling minions.

The stench of gunpowder and brine is thick in the air, for the fiend brings Undead artillerymen of the sea. Already they have dragged their rickety cannons onto the field. We must be wary of their bombardments.
And… what is this? He has brought some Druchii thralls to battle with him! This Vampire certainly knows how to get my attention. This indignity must be met with all the rage of Caledor!
The Vampire wishes to drink the blood of my allies, the mighty Drakes, but he will do no such thing. I shall defeat him and send him and his minions back to their graves!
Knight of my great house! Ulthuan needs us now more than ever, for we are the absolute of its warriors.
The Vortex is the legacy of my bloodline. Somewhere beneath the swirling maelstrom, the great Caledor Dragontamer eternally stands in conjuration, protecting us still.
The summoning of the Skaven’s verminous god threatens everything he sacrificed himself for.
This cataclysm cannot come to pass, brothers. It is time for Caledor to rise once again!
Hark, Kinsmen! It is now clear that the weakening of the Talisman was not without reason. The medallion’s connection to the ancient Waystones has revealed a dire fate.
This Ruinous host of Chaos seeks to destroy this Waystone, and all others that protect Ulthuan. Our proximity to it shall grant us its power, but it also nourishes our foes.
The Keepers of the Stones send aid from the mountain pass to the north, but the river will not slow these twisted beings for long. We must hold this position to the last.
If we fail, Yvresse will fall, and all Ulthuan will be next. The fate of the vortex – nay, the entire world – rests on our shoulders.
I’ve always known this day would come. Grom the Fat’s appetite for destruction knows no bounds and he has led his foul horde back to the gates of our city once more.
Hold the walls as long as you can my warriors, but if absolutely necessary we shall fall back and make a last stand in front of the tower.
Above all, the Waystone must not fall, for its destruction will be the catalyst for all Ulthuan’s doom.

Remember, if the walls are breached, we must retreat through the main gangways. By Lileath’s will, their mobs shall follow us right into the enchanted traps set by our Mages. May the power of Mathlaan and Azyr strike them down.
Grom will not stop until Tor Yvresse is left in flames and rubble. But I have defeated his horde before, and will do so again. This time, he will have no escape – I will make sure of it.
Ahh yes! Forest Spirits, come!
Soon the enemy will taste the vengeance of our fallen sisters!
Aid me Forest Spirits! I speak for the Tree of Woe!
We are strong! Let us rend the enemy asunder!
Coeddil comes! Our vengeance now awaits!
We shall show them that we are the true keepers of the forest! All will suffer our...
Ancient!
Vengeful!
Wrath!
I am here, Coeddil! The time has come. Your freedom is at hand.
The Wildwood Rangers approach. The foolish saplings dare to try and stop us.
In the hallowed name of every Tree Spirit that has fallen due to Asrai negligence, the dirt shall be fertilised with Elven blood this day – I will make sure of it.
We shall show them that we are the true keepers of the forest, not them!
Chaos! Forest spirits forgive me, I did not know!
Then for the sake of all my kin, I must ally with you who stole the woods from us.
But do not think this dims my wrath, Elves! Your poison queen's time will yet come…
No! That… that is a portal to the Dreaming Wood! How could I have been so blind?
If the vile Ariel cannot seal it, the Daemons of Chaos will raze my forest!
Coeddil forgive me, but for the sake of all Loren, I must ally myself with the hated Elves.
Where's my Dragon, Cloven Ones!?
Patience, Arahan. Behold, the horned shaman perform some dark rite with their obscene stones. I know not the intent of these servants of Chaos, but it surely bodes ill.
More pointless busywork, Naestra? How typically tedious of you. Well, at least I get to slaughter a few Beastmen.

I sense a far greater reward than indulging your childish bloodthirst, sister. Ceithin-Har is near, but... bound, and in shadow. If we can stop this fell ritual, perhaps our winged friend shall at last be revealed to us?
I thought I smelled something else, too. In the trees... No, it's... probably nothing. Let's go get our Dragon back.
For the forest!
Our queen is in place. The sealing rite begins. Chaos shall not breach this realm!
I'm bored already, Naestra. What else can we kill?
There is no shortage of vermin with which to slake your tiresome thirst for carnage, sister.
Their leader is hideous, even for a rat. And so big! This hunt shall be glorious!
Think not of glory, Arahan. Should that warp-maddened brute prevent the Mage-Queen from completing her ritual, doom absolute shall follow.
Have no fear, dear Naestra. I have arrows enough for all its mutant limbs, and all its chittering kin. No more rats, and no more Chaos. Oh, this will be fun!
Then to battle, sister!
For the Queen in the Woods! For all Athel Loren!
You!
Sold out by a tree. No wonder the rats knew our every move.
Your foolhardy hate blinds you to the true threat, Drycha. Great Ariel's spell is all that safeguards our forest - your forest - from the monstrosities of Chaos.
In other words, if the queen dies, we all die. Time to pick a side, Dryad.
Fool-fool Chaos-things attack Hell Pit again! Why they not learn lesson last time-time?
Big problem, yes? Hell Pit not send abomination-monsters to other clan-clans til spiky-things gone-gone!
Why Ghoritch-thing not stop-kill Chaos-things yet? Fool-fool Rat-Ogre! Stupid man-thing brain make it weak-frail!
Bah! Me must do all thing-things, make nasty spiky-things die-die quick-fast, or other clans be mad-mad. Keeps me from lab-lab! And me so hungry... HUNGRY!
Maybe me eat Ghoritch-thing once Chaos-things dead-dead. Or maybe... me put Ghoritch-thing brain into Plague Toad, hee-hee-hee-hoo-hah-hah-hah!
Ha! There Elf queen-thing! At last-last! She cast great spell-spell, just as strange tree-thing said-told.
She busy-occupied – so can take-steal, eat magic pulp-flesh! Me finally cure the HUNGER! Hah-hah-ha-hee!
First, other nasty Elf-things must die-die. Me eat best bits, yes-yes? Experiments, ratkin, set-ready! Fight for Moulder clan! Fight for THROT!
Fail and me eat arms and leg-legs! Stitch-sew heads onto socket-holes! Put brains in worm-things!
You not fail-lose! Go-go! Ah-hah-hah-hah-ha! ....Me so hungry....
Tree-thing fool-fool! Not betray Throt! Me care not what nasty Chaos-things do to forest-wood.
Only want Elf queen-thing! Tree-thing burn-burn too! Hah-hah-hah-hee!
Floaty bug-thing dead-dead! So much for fool-fool demi-god! Hee-hah-hah-ha! Quick-fast, bring Elf-thing body to me. NOW-NOW!
Yes-yes! We have queen-bug-thing! Now will feast-devour, finally be free-free! First, must scuttle-scurry away. Very-very bad things coming…
Morghur weak! Leader of nothing. Me strongest!
Morghur's brayherd obeys Taurox now! Release prisoners! Begin sacrifices!
Many sacrifices made. Dark Masters are pleased!
Hated Coldskins stalk Taurox. Now they die too.
The hiding coward is here... Good! All will be sacrifices. More favour for Taurox!
At last! The Heart of the Dark. The Great Herdstone belong to Taurox! Wait… What?
Morghur! By the Dark Gods… Taurox is chosen! Taurox is Strongest! Grrrgh!
Morghur already bring offerings to the Herdstone… Taurox take them! Taurox make sacrifice for Dark Masters! Hurr!
Daemons flock to Heart of the Dark. They come for Taurox’s offering, not Morghur’s! Taurox must appease Dark Masters…
I challenge! If Morghur not surrender, Taurox crush him! Feel Bloodgreed! To War!
Dark Masters grant Taurox vision of great victory! This Taurox destiny, here and now. We slaughter the Dark Elves, for Chaos!
They come from behind their walls. They come to meet the Bloodbeast in battle… The Dark Elves want blood, Taurox give them blood!
We meet the Elves at river crossing. We pile their puny bodies high. We slaughter them for Dark Masters, and the river run red with their blood!
At long last, the lost treasures of our Ancestors are within reach! So long have I dreamed of this day!
To think of all we've endured here, so far from home. And now brothers, our reward is finally at hand!
What? No! Wretched vermin! How dare they sully this place with their vile presence!
Warriors at the ready! Destroy every last trace of this Raki pestilence — we can't let them breach the vault!
These repulsive creatures defile our very history! For that, they will pay in blood!
Blasted Raki Vermintide, they just don't know when they're beaten!
Hold the pass brothers, and give no quarter! The might of the Dawi will not be broken this day!
It's time to bring the wrath of Grimnir down upon them, and cleanse this infestation once and for all!
To arms, fellow Dawi! This insolent lout thinks to steal our quarry out from under us!
Blinded by youth and ignorance! Your worthless new technologies spit in the face of the Ancestors, Jorek!
Clearly the Trouser Legs Ritual you suffered all those years ago did not put you in your place. Now I must be the one to do so!
The beast is ours! No man, creature or Dawi will stand in our way!
To glory, hazkals! Let's claim one more victory for the old ways!
We have bided our time long enough. The purpose of this fell place is clear, the time for action is now.
Behold, the one known as Taurox brings vast numbers of other Children of Chaos, beckoned by the dark power of that stone.
His sacrificial rites are a critical step for Chaos’ advancement into the world, but freeing his captives will slow his progress.
We have the upper hand – for now – but this Doombull must be struck down before he musters more cohorts.
Ready yourselves, braves. The Children of Chaos are the sworn enemies of the Old Ones, and the entire world. They must not prevail!
The Cloven Ones no longer have reinforcements! Their forces flee!
The Dark Gods must be deprived of their sacrificial offerings. If we kill the Great Bray-Shaman overseers, the prisoners shall go free.
Our allies join the fight. Advance, braves! Advance!
The captives bolster our numbers!
The warmbloods fight as allies. Chaos truly is a bane to all.
This will not end until the Bloodbeast is slain! We must send him to oblivion where all Chaos belongs!
I have seen the horror of the Ruinous Powers. Wherever their influence spreads in this world, death surely follows.
A mere trinket is all Chaos needs to strengthen its grip over the younger races.
Ready yourselves, braves! The untamed ones approach, expecting to secure more fell artefacts.
The traders of Naggaroth are also near – let them come. They too will meet their end.
Their colluders dare not come, already punished for their crimes. The warmbloods shall face us alone.
Vermin dare infest my capital? Skavenblight over-exerts itself.
I will not tolerate pests in Naggarond. The vermin will learn that my city, my realm, is a cold, cruel place.
Purge the city, my warriors, but ensure you leave some alive - I wish to know how loud a rat can scream.
Fellow Asur, hear my words! Yet again the Druchii come at us - a never-ending a tide of war.
But Ulthuan’s cliffs are strong! Its shores refuse to be washed away by the waves of our hated kin.
Today we must guard Lothern’s sea walls – let the Druchii torrent come!
Their waves will break upon us! Turn back the flood! For Ulthuan, for the Phoenix King, for Asuryan!
These warmbloods are aligned with the ancient enemy. They must be destroyed.
When the threat is eradicated I may contemplate the greater peril.
Begin the purge!
Why-why Gnawdwell, send Queek down to this backwater? To make fool of Queek, yes-yes?!
I not fail here – I make Clan Mors great in south, make Clanrats chirp my name! Make lands mine-mine!
Start by killing Elf-things! I want them dead-dead!
Go-go! Kill! Do not fail me-me!
The warmbloods trespass...
Fallen Gates not for them.
Their magic-users dare to activate the stellar engine at centre... Ignorance!
Forwards - cross the bridge! I must see trespassers punished!
Attack now! Destroy and rend, so declares Lord of Solar-City!
These Chaos dredges bore me. At least with the Asur I can enjoy their death screams. Yet it is a labour that must be undertaken.
I claim this altar, not in Khaine’s name, but mine own.
Savants of the desperate Gods, I advise you stay out of my way,
If not, you shall face the might of the Druchii, and our ways of killing are far more inventive than your own!
Fools! Herds of Asur clog the path to Vaul’s petty shrine. Sweep them aside, my kin!
Let the king approach the god and have the god kneel!
Send forth the vanguard - have them prepare my way.
Vaul will deign to bless my sword; he will marvel at my creation - or I will destroy all of his!
Those that thought to slay me, know that I hold no grudge, for betrayal is part of our way.
But now… now I expect you to die for me.
The reptiles will seek to snare us. But we are the hunters - the trap is mine to spring - ensure it is executed.
Begin the attack, return to me my Spellshield - ensure we are the hunters, not the prey!
My son will learn that I am not a doll that can be cast aside when he tires of me!
I shall take this sanctuary and from the souls within compose a song of screams and torment!
Let them come to the shore, sally from their pristine walls, so I can smear them in Asur blood!
Bring me this colony, sisters, kill many - but make sure half are taken alive!
I see the Witch King’s armies, but not Malekith himself!
They say he is scared of me - that he worries about a prophecy that foretells his doom by a magic-wielder of male aspect.
Perhaps he cowers on his Black Ark?
Do not show these fallen-kin mercy for they have never shown us any…
For Lileath, for the Phoenix Throne, for Ulthuan!
Steel yourselves, my kin, for now we fight not just to reclaim the War Crown for the honour of Saphery, but to vanquish the children of the Horned God.
They will come at us mercilessly, but know that every Skaven is a coward.
They are only emboldened in numbers, and so we must cut them down. The creatures that remain will become ever more craven!
Let me deal with the Bat, it has slain two creatures of Ulthuan and they must be avenged!
Elves of Ulthuan to me! The scum of Naggaroth approach.
They think to cage us in… but is the lion trapped when cornered by the rat? Do warriors squirm when confronted by weaklings?
No is the answer!
Gird your souls, let them come!
This is a sad day for Ulthuan, when Asur fights Asur within sight of the White Tower.
Bel-Korhadris would surely weep, as I will for the dead that I slay this day.
But make no mistake, I will reap a toll, for my honour has been called into question.
The offence must be sated - and only then shall I take up Sunfang to fight the true enemies of the Phoenix Throne!
Purge this swamp.
Drain it of filth, of the warm-blood’s presence.
The way must be purged, so I can approach the revered Old One.
Do this quickly, time marches against us!
I will bring ruination to these warm-blooded Rat-abominations!
They were never part of the Old Ones’ plan - an accident of the cosmos - that must be rectified.
All need to be annihilated in time, but first start with these Vermin-spawn!
Prepare to defend the Gate, it must not fall into the clutches of the enemy.
Your lives are nothing compared to this objective. Enforce my will - but do not sell your essence short.
If you must die, then take as many of the enemy’s servants with you.
I have spoken, that is my will - see it is done.
Dwarf-things! Look how they scurry to us on such little legs! Racing to fight-fight!
We will give them battle, yes-yes! I’ll take back Gouger, and collect many beards this day-day!
No other rat must slay more than me-me. Any who attempt to out-kill me-me will pay!
Get them! Get them now-now!
Says his armour is more special than mine does he-he! Then I will take-steal it! I am Queek! The best stuff shall be mine.
But cunning is this vermin, yes-yes. I will have to be wary. Make sure Clanrats set off the traps - better they die than me-me!
Scurry-forward now-now, begin-fight! Kill-kill!
Such a paradise! Unblemished. Pure. It must be gifted the touch-touch of Pestilens!
That the Reptile-things attack me-me for this is blasphemy!
Lead me to the Crimson Skull so I make it powder and restore my Rod of Corruption, yes-yes!
Let us begin - yes-yes!
Quick-quick, get my book!
Ignore the Dead-things. Fight them. Kill or be killed; does not matter!
Only Liber Bubonicus matters. First get-get these corpses out of my way! Kill-slay zombie summoners!
Do as I bid - Clan Pestilens supreme!
Cowardly wretches, hiding from your betters. Your tricks will not protect you from the onslaught of my beasts!
They think to free their cold-blooded kin? Their freedom will be found only in obedience.
Foolish Nakai, you are nothing but another beast to be broken!
I will teach this reptillian scum what it means to truly dominate your foes.
We shall send these insolent currs scurrying back to their jungles in fear, as I bend their revered spirit to my will!
Though I care little for the Witch King’s schemes, we have a deal.
Once the Vortex is secured, the world will bow to Druchii power and my beastly legions shall be granted the highest position in his military echelons.
The rats and their Horned God shall not prevent my glory.
They are no mere beasts to be tamed, their only destiny is destruction. I will deliver it!
I sit upon the precipice of godhood, and you have the gall to believe that the bear’s carrion is yours? Come then, try and take it!
You built an empire to sustain this futile quest – that is the first thing I shatter after my ascension. As I feast on Ursun’s power, my Soul-Grinders shall feed on yours…
I may not be a god yet… but you will *suffer*
My majesty!
For Chaos to achieve total destruction of the mortal realm, one God cannot dominate the others.
The Everchosen comes to stop the final ritual!
Do not meddle in my destiny!
Finally, my destiny has arrived. The spoils within that Altar ensure a place at my master’s side. N’Kari… Sigvald… will not even be worthy enough to kiss my claw!
First, I must break open the Altar to gain the Dark Prince’s favour. It shall be my greatest endeavour!
I need only claim enough of the Altar’s Marks of Power – and depose any who dare get in my way! What fun we shall have!
So, the Blood God sends forth his murderous peons…
Mindless bludgeons! Unworthy of my time. Have my minions see to them!
There is only one champion worthy of the spoils inside that Altar – and it is not Khorne’s!
You are nothing to me, Everchosen!
Nurgle’s maggots approach. They dare try to claim what is mine! I best disabuse them of this notion.
Finally, Tzeentch’s machinations reveal themselves. They will not stop me! It is my right to feel the Dark Prince’s caress!
At last - the Altar is mine to defile!
Despair all ye realms, the Leechlord has come, the sad days of this world are nearing their sum!
Mmmm, the sweet stench of death, of souls trapped… Nurgle’s tribute still locked behind the Altar’s seal…
But what do we have here? Marks of Power to claim… power to conquer the Altar. Nurgle’s chosen shall deliver His prize!
Well met, Children of the Changer! Do you come to meet your sickly fates early?
The puppet master’s puppets will all soon be servants of decay, along with the rest of the world!
O ye faithful of the Fly Lord, fill their breeches with soil, the time has come for a bit of deathly toil!
The Undivided are undeserving of Ruinous glory! You shall rot into nothingness, Everchosen!
Do not resist, slaves of Slaanesh! Once the world is Nurgle’s dominion, you too can be my plague-carriers. Your unsanitary ways will come in handy to spread His pestilent ruin!
Khorne sends His angry little thralls, and not just for fighting’s sake methinks. He knows! Once the Urfather’s power rises, His followers will not be spared the world’s despair!
The other Gods’ children are proven unworthy! The sickly blessings of Nurgle shall be ours!
Sweet boons of war! I come for the Bloodfather’s gifts, yet it seems I will get even more.
How fond I am of the quarrelsome, green-skinned simpletons. So easy to slay, yet just as easy to bring to battle!
And the ratmen, craven they may be, but always willing to brawl for their worthless lives.
Perhaps some will be worthy enough to stay here and fight for Khorne forever. Let us find out!
Aches, pains, malady, malaise, Nurgle works in mysterious ways!
I’d come to his realm for a good harvest, but nowt so close to being this marvellous!
Ten CC’s of Jabberslythe bile…
...mixed with a Cygor’s vitreous humour, makes for ulcers, cankers and tumours!
Steel yourselves, servants of blight, the beasties are always up for a fight!
Ahh, Morathi sends me some fresh delicacies from the mortal realm.
Little Elven souls to be plucked like ripe fruit. So sweet to taste.
I know they say it is bad manners to play with your food, but I can't help but sample their agony.
There is something delicious about a soul that has no hope!
Ready your blades, minions, for it is time to consume!
Thomin, dear brother, I comprehend the task our master has given us.
Ahh, Yes, I see! The Changer of Ways has delivered to us the two great empires of this world.
First come the dogs of the Empire. But the cattle of Cathay are not far behind!
Patience, brother! I foresee there are plenty of bones for you to break, flesh for you to tear.
But first we must soften them up, for the tortures to come!
What a glorious journey of slaughter it has been! Soon we shall unleash the true savagery of Khorne upon the world!
For now, the Altar’s seal endures, withholding my paramour’s tribute. How His brother-gods must gaze upon us and laugh…
But let them laugh! Once we claim enough of the Altar’s Marks of Power, no challenger will stop us from taking the Bloodfather’s dues!
The debauched ways of Slaanesh will be a mere sideshow to the world's Ruin. In the end, there can only be murder!
They will fall before Khorne’s chosen! Clear the Altar of this fodder!
With the Gods as my witness, I will prove you unworthy of being the Everchosen, pretender!
Tzeentch’s arduous plans are being undone, for he sends a cowardly host! The destruction of the mortal realm can only be by the reaping of blood and skulls – not conniving and conjuration!
Nurgle must want me to put his lepers out of their misery! After all, a world abound with a million hosts of Khorne will have no need for the Rot-God’s influence!
The pathetic challengers are no more! Finally we will claim the Bloodfather’s tribute!
See, brother! This has all happened according to our design.
That power is mine! And all those that have mocked us shall suffer!
No, fool! The Altar remains locked for now, but I know the way to access it.
Get us those Marks of Power – do not disappoint me – they are the key to breaking open the Altar’s seal!
Does the Urfather send his slaves against us? We shall deal with them – time to clean up!
None shall stop us, brother! I have foreseen it!
We have bested you before, Everchosen, and will again. Ask Jharkill!
[[col:blue]]…![[/col]]
Yes, Thomin! More creatures for you to mangle. Khorne’s puppets are nothing against our might!
Pitiful Slaanesh. The young are always the last to know. There are no secrets here. Only the truth that the Altar is ours!
Brother, it is finally ours!
I will not have these foul Undead defile my domain, and disrupt production!
Annihilate them! I want to see nothing but burnt bones.
The Legion of Azgorh goes to battle. Any that do not perform shall answer to me!
The ultimate blessings of Hashut are nigh.
Bound to the Great Drill, the Ancestor relics cede their power to the diabolical machine.
A terrifying feat of forge-craft to bore into the Chaos Realm.
The blood of the Bull-God, now at the fingertips of the worthiest Dawi-Zharr.
Yet there are those who seek to interfere with Hashut’s plan.
The Dawi seek vengeance for the pilfering of their relics!
By braving this place, they surely bring doom upon themselves.
Hashut's wrath comes for all of you!
Burn the Dwarfs in sorcerous fire!
Such fools. I'll take great pleasure in purging them!
Without warning, the igneous barrier between worlds is suddenly breached…
...but the Sorcerer-Prophets struggle to contain the torrent of escaping Chaos magic.
Other Daemonic powers are seizing their moment, bringing forth horrors from the other side that thirst for slaughter!
The Dawi-Zharr must ensure that only Hashut prevails!
With the Chaos magic contained, the Blood of Hashut flows forth.
But there is one final challenge to this unlimited power. The grudge-bearer and his cronies approach!
There! There they are. The traitors… the grudge-mongers… the vile wretched Dawi-scum that have fled the love of our Ancestors!

We stop this abomination that burrows into the rock! A machine powered by remnants of our gods. Such desecration must be answered in kind. I will tear out every page of the Dammaz Kron to address this most wanton of grudges!
Loyal Dwarfs, the clans of the Karaz Ankor unite! Ready your axes, cleave the heads of every Dawi-Zharr you come across. Burn their beards! Dreng them! DRENG THEM ALL!
The conclave of Zharr-Naggrund sends me to investigate this deficit in production. An insult and waste of my time!
I’ll make these work-shy scum pay for this distraction! And then I’ll see the Overseers turned to ash.
All here will suffer the wrath of Zhatan the Black!
The fools in Zharr-Naggrund think to unmake my majesty, and so my legions will ensure the safety of this Convoy. Have the thralls load it up! Prepare to leave!
Enemies are close... I can feel it it as much as the stone-dust in my blood.
Once the Convoy reaches the clearing no enemy will dare to attack us, and victory will be mine!
These traitors have fled back to their vile benefactor and revealed the source of the pox on our lands.
This virulent mire may be their domain, but I know you brave and true warriors of Cathay will not shirk your duty.
Our enemies think themselves safe here, in their new home. But the Dragon Emperor's reach is long, and none can hide from his judgement.
The turncoat pawns shield their bloated master. Our fallen countrymen must be dispatched first.
And then, the Executioner’s axe comes for the Daemon. Once it has fallen, harmony will be restored to Grand Cathay!
A great reservoir of magic lurks below, revealed to me by the spirits of home...
The entrance is close… but so too come the three Beastmasters, just as foretold.
The Naggarothi are as children in their weakness to corruption by power.
They may cower behind their beasts of burden, but they must never enter that cave.
To the spirit realm with you, creatures! I will send your masters into the dirt.
Then at the last… the cave’s guardian to slay. Fire up my cauldron, daughters!
What is the worth of mortal life without a little Chaos?
Let the Dawi think they have a chance… even if they live long enough, the truth will not spare them from slaughter.
Taketh from one, giveth to another… the Dwarfs’ pride makes them such low-hanging fruit.
And men, so blinded by their greed that they do not even care that they fight alongside Tzeentch’s hosts!
What a shame the others do not want to come out and play. Should they learn the truth, perhaps they will.
My staff has merely been the carrot, and I am the stick. Let the game begin!
Come on, who's scared of a little Dragon? Think of the opportunities!
Oh look, elgi on their fancy ponies. Time for some target practice!
Woah, that's a big lizard! Ready the cannons, Dawi! Gold for the one who takes its eye out!
Oh, we've caught him with his pants down!
Run out of ammo have you? What a shame!
Now's our chance! Get the blasted Frundrar!
Put a few holes in 'em to get the guns calibrated, then the boss'll come running!
They underestimated us! Bloody idiots!
Here we go, let's get stuck in! Glory!
So that's who's been riling them up! Don't burn all of him, he'll be perfect material for some side projects!
They picked the wrong day to be made of wood!
Pity that's all of them, I was enjoying th-- Wait a minute. Spoke too soon! Incoming!
Get re-sighted lads! They got more stuff for us to shoot!
Let them come and try us! We'll kill 'em again!
It's that ugly one in the robe doing this! Shoot that one!
There's nothing better than fireworks that hit things!
The boss has finally shown his face! Get 'im in your crosshairs, if you have them!
This doesn't look good! We've got to get over there!
Got to smash through these guys so I can get to defusing!
Get going! Oh, and someone get me a drink, I need to steady my nerves!
Resting upon a vile Greenskin brow, the Nemesis Crown wreaks untold damage, seeding death in lands Elspeth von Draken has sworn to defend.
Bearing the shame of Alaric the Mad, the grobi menace marches to war, swarming beneath the Nemesis Crown's corruption.
Unworthy hands clutch at the Nemesis Crown, wielding the coveted powers of domination that the Maggot Lord demands.
Though the Greenskin leadership lies in tatters, this rearing serpent still bears fangs in need of ripping out…
Every banner the Greenskins march beneath must be torn asunder, if the Crown is ever to be wrested from their grasp.
To the west, the Night Goblins amass in force, relishing the chance to bloody their wicked blades.
All the while, the spiders creep onwards from the east, and a million blinking eyes grow ever closer.
But heavy is the head that wears the crown... Cut it off, and this war host may scatter with the wind.
Weave death among this filth ‬– they have tainted our lands long enough!
Tek the heeds off this grobi scum! Today we undo Alaric's shame!
That'll be my crown! My power! Crush 'em all into a feast for the flies!

As the Day of Mystery thins the veil between worlds, Slaanesh enacts his vengeance, dragging enemies from across the mortal world into His dark realm. Among the captured, the rogues Gotrek and Felix fight, battling to escape the Prince of Pleasure's domain.
Only destroying His arcane portals would weaken the Dark Prince's grip, yet those protecting them will demand a toll in blood…
No matter the price, Gotrek and Felix cannot fall, for their survival will deal Slaanesh a deadly blow, and prove vital in the adventures to come!
It was a canny trick our brother used in bringing us here. I'd expect nothing less of an Engineer. Now... safeties off lads! Let's free our kin with our umgi allies, shall we?
I bet there's all kinds of poor saps trapped in those mines. Our Engineer friend could free 'em if we provide some good old "blackpowder distraction"!
Those Dark Elf wazzocks aren't going to know what's hit 'em! Whatever that Black Ark throws at us, we'll crack their heads and send 'em packing back to Naggaroth!
Somewhere 'round here is the eight-legged wazzock we're looking for…
Stay sharp, lads, we're not alone. I smell the stench of Goblins up ahead…
No matter, though, 'cos our Hewers will make short work of 'em!
Steel yerselves, lads, our quarry is close now…
Watch yerselves, the Brood Mother is a monstrous beast for sure. When we put her down, the glory will be all ours!
These harbingers of Chaos bring nothing but death and destruction to our lands. These souls may be lost, but I shall not cower while the slaughter continues…
I know not what Daemonic horrors await beyond their portals, and I do not plan to find out!
Their sacrificial rites must end, now – my Pale Scythe will see to it, one way or another...
Either it cleaves their cultist in twain to halt the foul magics of his ritual, or weakens the awaiting Daemons by ending his victims' misery.
Whatever the outcome, we will soak this battlefield in blood and the Winds of Shyish shall blow a gale.
Virtue demands we spare them no mercy!
The Urfather's gifts have found their way to the Asur!
Look at how they suffer! Every cough, splatter and lax, glorious to behold.
My host will give them life's final release, for that is what Nurgle demands.
There shall be no cure for the death we bring!
To endure Hexensnacht will be no easy feat – even for a great warlord such as I – but the rewards will be worth this trial.
Greenskin sorcery! These Shamans call upon an even more powerful idol. I will crush them to sever their link with the creature!
A vast host appears, belonging to Khargan's enemies. This rivalry ends now – then the Crazed one will serve the warband forever in my debt.
I have foreseen these unwelcome Daemons who corrupt Nurgle's realm. Ketzak now bids me to heed the call from beyond!
The hunger of the Great Unclean Ones is legendary, but this one turns its appetite on its own. For that, Nurgle will have me put it down.
So, Skraelsbane has developed a taste for Skin Wolves? Norsca’s beasts could be useful to the warband – if we can prevent the wolf-kin’s doom.
Mighty host of Nurgle, Nuln awaits us! Once the wriggling worms this side of the river are all dead, we'll march on their precious little city…
First, we pulverise their flesh, then we will have our choice of crossings. Left bridge, right bridge – whichever we pick, it will be futile to resist us!
The cowards think their rockets will stop us! But we will crush their little machines and grind the mewling spawn into paste.
And more of the Empire's toys await us across the bridge, mounted by beady eyes. I will take pleasure in plucking them out.
Then, to the city and its fodder. I am sure the garrison is eager for an audience with the Maggot Lord…
My great conquest is finally at hand! Nuln and its souls, mine for the taking – gifts worthy of my rise to Daemonhood!
Warriors of Kislev! We have travelled far and fought hard, but at last we have arrived in Khorne's bloody realm.
Before us stands the Brass Citadel, where the Blood God's gatekeeper stands guard. We must call out the fiend, and slay him!
He rallies his Daemons for a last, desperate defence. Vanquish them – with ice and steel!
This is the Ruined Fort, defended by Khorne's lesser thralls. Wipe them out and capture the Icon of Ruin. This will give me a foothold and grant us supplies, to reinforce for the struggle ahead.

My brave Kislevites! We stand triumphant! But Khorne is not the only Dark God with a realm in this accursed place. The battle is won, but the war goes on... Come. We must continue our search for what is lost.
The Icon of Ruin is ours, and we have supplies to fortify our position.
Use them to construct defensive towers here.
We can barricade these bottlenecks.
Use the portals to summon fresh troops or heal and upgrade our warriors, using whatever supplies we have left.
Khorne's Daemons attack! Hold fast, warriors!
We must press on into the Blood Pits, and seize the Icon of Blood!
The Icon of Blood is ours! Beyond the portal wait Kislev's greatest defenders, ready to fight! Use the fresh supplies to summon them. Construct more towers and barricades to help the defence.
One final push, to the Boiling Moat! We must seize the Icon of Torment, and tempt Khorne's gatekeeper from his lair!
I claim the Icon of Torment – the Daemon will come! Use the last of our supplies to ready our defences. Raise towers! Raise barricades! And summon forth the greatest of the Motherland's Champions.
Khorne's Gatekeeper shows himself at last! Warriors of Kislev, prepare for the fight of your lives!
The Brass Citadel! The keep of the Blood God. Home of the Skull Throne.
The Citadel is guarded by eight hundred and eighty-eight Bloodthirsters, but we need only breach its outer-defences to draw out the Gatekeeper.
Start at the Ruined Fort, defeat its garrison and capture the Icon of Ruin. This will give you a foothold and grant us supplies to reinforce for the struggle ahead.
There are two other Icons you will need to capture and so dominate the battle.
You have drawn the Blood God's gaze, make sure you are worthy of his attention. Let the slaughter begin!
Khorne's Gatekeeper! This is the Daemon Prince whose soul we seek.
The Mansion of the Plague Lord. The Crooked Manor of Nurgle.
None would survive crossing its threshold, but the Gardener will come as soon as we trespass upon its outer-defences!
Capture the Canker-Tree in the Garden of Blight. This will give you a foothold and grant us supplies to reinforce for the struggle ahead.
There are two other Trees you will need to claim and so dominate the battle.
Nurgle is amused you have made it this far. Slay His servants and ensure He will not mock you again!
There is the Gardener, Nurgle's Daemon Prince! Slay him!
The Palace of Slaanesh, where the Dark Prince's harem resides.
A full-on incursion is not desired or warranted – we need only penetrate its outer-defences and the Courtesan shall reveal themselves.
Begin at the Wall of Twisted Flesh. Disperse its defenders and capture the Statue of Perfection. This will give you a foothold and grant us supplies to reinforce for the struggle ahead.
There are two other statues you will need to capture and so dominate the battle.
Slaanesh senses your desire to slay His chosen prince. Channel this to your own advantage, not His!
The Courtesan appears! We must kill this Daemon Prince and take their soul!
The Impossible Fortress… impregnable to all but the insane.
To enter the Fortress unbidden would be a mistake, but piercing its defences will suffice to summon the wrath of the Librarian.
Control the Crystal of Lore in the labyrinth. This will give you a foothold and grant us supplies to reinforce for the struggle ahead.
There are two other crystals you will need to capture and so dominate the battle.
Confound the Great Changer! Refuse to play the part He has written for you, and destroy all who get in your way!
The Librarian is summoned! Execute Tzeentch's favoured Daemon Prince and steal his soul!
The journey has been long, but we are ready. Fellow Ungols, we are of Kislev - show these cowardly dogs what that means. They hunger for blood, let them taste cold steel!
Let the Wolf believe he hunts! I say he is the prey! We use the high ground, and strike his pack low. For Kislev!
I need – Ursun needs – that Altar!
But it is defended by one of the Blood God's wretched pets!
You will fight, and some may die, for the Blood God demands blood, and we shall gladly give it!
All that matters is reaching the shrine.
Ursun is lost, but there is a way to find him within the maze!
Strike down the Daemons which guard its profane walls!
The traitor squanders his power!
He takes the role of petty warlord, bartering with marauder scum!
I have a Greater Daemon at my side… I will show them ALL how to wield true power!
I sit upon the precipice of Godhood, and you have the gall to believe that the Bear’s carrion is yours? Come then, try and take it!
You built an empire to sustain this futile quest – that is the first thing I shatter after my ascension. As I feast on Ursun’s power, my Soul-Grinders shall feed on yours…
I may not be a god yet… but you will *suffer* my majesty!
I am the spine-crusher… the skull-taker… the blood-quencher
I am violence
I am WAR
I am WRATH
I am RAGE INCARNATE
I am Skarbrand, the UNFORGIVEN!

A trap then! They come before we enter the Changer's maze. Clear the path my subjects, The Crystal Cloak was worn by the Khan-Queens of old. I claim it, and even the hexes of Tzeentch cannot overrule my birthright!
Steady your hearts, brothers and sisters of Kislev. The Great Deceiver sends his puppets, but the Motherland protects, embrace her and we will see victory!
My father! Already ensnared by Chaos magicks. Sons and daughters of Kislev, we will not let these foul puppets deprive us of Kislev's sire once more.
Steel your hearts – we fight to free the Red Tzar!

There! There the knife-eared devils come to take you from Ursun's grasp. To spirit you across the heathen waters where you will eke out your lives misery and toil in sin, far from Ursun's embrace! Is that what you want? IS IT?!
Then show me your hatred! If you love the Bear you will happily die rather than be taken.

Ursun's chosen! Boris Ursus! Defiled by the sworn enemies of Father Bear! Sons and daughters of Kislev… GET THEM! Throw your bodies in front of their cursed blades. Do whatever you must to save the Red Tzar!
Slops-a-gravy, beggar's crumb. Finger-more and skip the thumb! I crave what a crave and that is Dwarfen-scum!
I will have their hands and heads in my vice… so best to infect them all with foetid beard-lice!
[Sinister but weirdly warm laugh – like that uncle you don't like laughing at his own joke]

My crown ain't as shiny as it used to be. 'at's your fault! You let this Orc rampage through my lands without giving 'im any bother! That stops now! This battle's goin' to be huuge, that ain't no lie! And no one lies betta dan me!
I brought this git here, now we goin' to swallow him whole, chew on his eyeballs and throw his nads into the Fire Mouth!
Right! Let's get to it!
''ERE RATTY-RATTIES! 'ERE RATTY-RATTIES!
Come and have a sniff of dis cheese. It’s all 'ere, in ma pot. Just scamper over and jump in!
Oh Maw... they hang back... It's, it's a rat-trap! I ain't trapped 'ere with them…
THEY'RE TRAPPED 'ERE WITH ME!
You are in my way, Asur. Move aside and I may grant you a gift rarely bequeathed on my other playthings… a quick and mildly-painful death.
But vex me and the agonies I shall visit upon you and your descendants will be as legend – sung in the halls of the Marcher Fortress for eternity!
Bring them to me, my fiends – the feast begins!
We remember this. We recall being you!
You must relent, the Staff is ours! We will not be blinded to fate by your petty context!
Die! – so we can calibrate real-space… and witness the vast fractals of existence once more.
Minions, go forth. Sunder the inevitable!
Battles are fought between armies of fighting troops. Your forces may be eager and ready to fight, yet only through your leadership may your troops gain victory.
The enemy advance! Ready your forces for battle!
Ultimate Darkness awaits you, challenger.
Tzeentch manifests this ancient altar of Chaos so renowned on the mortal plane.
An insurmountable battle this may be, but far from a futile endeavour.
For this beacon of power grants great abilities – wield them and prove yourself!
Behold “Black Fire Pass”, legendary crucible of battle.
Recreated by the Changer of Ways for His own twisted enjoyment.
Though He gifts you powerful abilities, death is inevitable here.
Beneath His gaze you will be measured not by victory, but by the slaughter you wreak!
Prepare yourself, Princeling, to indulge in Tzeentch’s mockery of the Fallen Gates.
His powerful conjurations grant special powers in this place, but also certain death.
Slaughter shall bring recognition; recognition shall bring reward.
The Children of the Old Ones await you in battle!
Welcome to “Hel Fenn”, Daemon Prince.
Tzeentch manifests this cursed haunt in His realm, but with a twist.
Though his gaze grants you power, there is no victory to be had here – only validation.
Use the abilities bestowed upon you and revel in slaughter!
How the God of Magic delights in His own playground of war!
Where the laws of reality are twisted by His inscrutable whims.
Here you will be pitted against the greatest Lord of Change of all, whose host will be unending.
The power of Tzeentch is yours – but will His rewards be too?
The journey has been long, but we are ready.
Fellow Ungols, we are of Kislev – show these cowardly dogs what that means. They hunger for blood, let them taste cold steel!
Yuri, hear me... as my paragon, I pass my strength on to you. Speak with my voice. Let the traitors hear you roar!
This fool dares challenge me?! He thinks I care about his trivial lust for power?
I will teach him a bitter lesson - one for all who defy me, who dare to oppose the will of the Chaos Gods!
Here is a maggot to make an example of! It will be a warning to all the Chieftains of the North.
Now, my followers, let us attend this tiresomeness - by dusk I wish to be swilling the maggot’s blood in his upturned skull, while channelling his ravaged spirit into Morkar’s armour!
Even as this Daemon-spawn plots to overthrow me, I know my destiny is absolute. Be’lakor will coronate me!
Come then, Changer, bring your best! I will prove once more that I am the Everchosen…
For I am the Anointed, the Bringer of Woes - the one, true, LORD OF CHAOS!
At last! A worthy challenger comes!

Not some weak minion sent by the Gods. No, what confronts me is something more corrupt, more bestial. It serves no master, seeks no glory other than its own! And that I applaud… even as I rip at its throats. For it must die. No man, no God… no creature, can challenge me and live!
Another thinks to bring me to my knees! Another who wishes me to bow before him, like he is some pitiless king!
Does he think his pathetic sorceries will work on me or my followers?

Come, my swords of Chaos, let us show this weakling conjurer who-would-be-royalty what I do to monarchs! He will see why I am the Lord of the End Times, why I am Everchosen, and why I will wield the Slayer of Kings!
The green things and Unliving alike will bear witness to my wrath! They are mine to dismember, to disembowel, to crush!
I will smash all that remains of these ruins to powder and not stop until my hammer is found.
And then the whole world will burn before I rest again - such is my rage - this is the new pact I make to the Dark Powers!  Raaaaargh!
Ah, my loyal minions. Over the way stands something I want… I need. Beatific mail, wasted on the clueless worm who wears it.
It is only right I take it from him, and if you, my serfs, die in agony during the attempt, then know that I'll feel your pain… why, I will relish it!

To the ‘champion’ in my armour… Yes, you may have heard of me. I am Sigvald the Magnificent, the Geld-Prince of Slaanesh. I do not blame you if hearing my name has caused you to void your bowels. Just make sure the Auric Armour is clean when I come to take it.
You could hand it straight over, of course, but I have seen your kind before. You will be irksome and make me fight for it.
No Matter! I could do with a workout - but do not over-vex me or your death-cry will be especially shrill and I do hate to taint my ears with such cacophonic nonsense if I can bear it.
Sickly, sinful, spectacles stand, shuffle, shamble and saunter shamelessly in mine scandalized sight! I suggest a solution...
Surely such sedition should sour and succumb to Sigvald - the salacious, scandalous and sensational servant of Slaanesh! Son of Succubi, scion of sordid acts and slayer of squalid serfs!

See how I stroll, stride, swagger and swirl, spin, slash and stab at stupid, senseless scum! Soon they shall swoon, shall seek solace and death from sundry torments wrought on them by my strategic, severing, scintillating shower of shimmering strikes!
Send for the sword - summon Sliverslash!
Puny Elf! Uncloven. Unknowing. Ignorant.
They take from me what is mine - weapon. Power!
They will regret. Morghur will change them; ruin them.
They will know our power, MY power! Raaarrr!

Graktar is lame… grrr… his time is over! Put him in ground, let him feed worms! Now is the time of Khazrak! They call me cunning, they call me the One-Eye - I call me Beastlord of all! RRRRRRAAAAARRRR!!!!
Take them now!
Bathe in their blood – feast on their guts – gnaw on their bones!
Let their puny wolf god know that it is the One-Eye who slaughters his pack!
Graktar is lame. His time is over!
Put him in ground, let him feed worms! Now is the time of Khazrak!
They call me cunning, they call me the One-Eye - I call me Beastlord of all!
RRRRRRAAAARRRRR! Take them now! Bathe in their blood – feast on their guts – gnaw on their bones! Let their puny wolf god know that it is the One-Eye who slaughters his pack! RRRRRRAAAAARRRR!!!!

See craven men! See them limp together like scared cattle… grr… They run no more; now is slaughter! Now we end lake hag's mongrels; now we end Sigmar's weak sons... grr... Kill for me, kill for dark masters, kill! That is why we were born! KILL!

I have seen it, my herd-kin! The Dark Masters, show me the way… grrrr… tear down their walls, burn their churches… grrrr… defile this river with man-filth bodies! Grrr… please me - your Crowfather - and let the Dark Omen spread… GRRRRRR!
I have seen it, my herd-kin!
The Dark Masters, show me the way. Tear down their walls, burn their churches…
Defile this river with man-filth bodies!
Please me - your Crowfather - and let the Dark Omen spread!
See craven men! See them limp together like scared cattle.
They run no more; now is slaughter! Now we end lake hag's mongrels; now we end Sigmar's weak sons.
Kill for me, kill for dark masters, kill! That is why we were born! KILL!
Sons of Sigmar, to me! Out there in that fen is a heretic, holding the Jade Griffon to his chest like the grubby thief he is!
To think that the talisman - a symbol of our Cult blessed by Magnus himself - is now in the clutches of this Necromancer and his Vampire consorts!
No! I say again, NO! Hunt down this filth, purge this place, and strike down any who dare to rise again - by the comet, that is my decree!
The Cult of Ulric has defamed us! The Midden-Wolves should be our allies, for was Sigmar not a worshipper of Ulric during his mortal span?
Instead they work against us, weakening the Empire that our sovereign lord, Emperor Karl Franz, has laboured so hard to unite under the Twin-Tailed Comet's glowing aspect.
I will have no more of this foolishness! Slay this representative of the Ar-Ulric, let that be chastisement enough, and then - if Sigmar permits - we may become brothers-in-arms once more.
Now we must fight this sorry battle, not for my honour but for that of Sigmar himself! To war!
Not long, my brothers. Soon I shall have the missing pages and with the Liber Noctus complete I can begin your true resurrection!
Mannfred may have set this task as a test, but I fear no challenge.
Now, go my minions - onwards! Take these living fools by surprise. I'll have that casket and the pages within!
I have not seen such a pathetic sight since mine father-in-law, Otto, took his last breath! Is this all that thine Empire can muster?
What a pitiful age this is! It makes me pander for the era of worthy foes, such as Wilhelm, or that Wolf Knight, Kruger... not this pathetic squabble of mortal men.
Yet my sword thirsts and so it shall be slaked in the blood of living fools that think to challenge the might of von Carstein. Let the slaughter begin!
Mine puppets, do me this deed. Purge the area of insects so thy master can collect this Warpstone unchallenged.
If mine memory serves, I sought out such material in Mordheim some centuries ago.
They were halcyon days - when my minions hunted wyrdstone and the Empire was in ruins, as it will be again...
Fetch me the head of this Strigoi - I would have this nuisance quashed!
All has happened before. All will happen again. Suffering is unending - battle, eternal.
The only answer is in kind; I will rise and smite the Undead outsiders.
Return to me the battle-gift of Daith that I might enact wrath upon the world!
This naive and foolish Glade Lord has allowed his mind to be poisoned by the Prince of Pleasure.
The Dreaming Woods are a forbidden place of great malice and deception, and in his folly our erstwhile brother has been twisted by the dark deeds within.
There can be no further mercy. As I am born from Kurnous' spirit, so shall these dark servants be purged by it.
Let them face the rage of the forest!
These beasts call themselves 'hunters'? Hah! Do they not know they face Orion, Master of the Wild Hunt?
Their auras cannot protect them now, for I am charged with the spirit of Kurnous; rage and destruction flow through me!
Fall upon them as the howling winds fall upon the winter leaves - show them that nothing can stand before the fury of the storm!
The seasons move ever on, and I feel the call to the Oak of Ages. Before I return to Ariel's embrace, another must be chosen to be born anew.
Yet these traitors would sully the forest and bear a corrupt vision into being through their blackened hearts. These curs cannot be suffered to live.
Though we challenge Anath Raema herself, the will of Kurnous must spurn her once more, and overcome these perverse desires!
The lost vault of Angrund is within reach!
Are we going to let these urk trespassers get away with their sneaky shenanigans? Do we let them steal the treasure and valuables which belong to the Angrund Clan by right?
No! We do not! Let the grudge be settled - let vengeance begin! Yaaaarh!
Yes, my kin, today is a great day! Today we kill urks! Today is vengeance!
Even now a throng from Karak Azul approaches the green-filth from the rear.
We are honoured to dreng the Orcs from the front - let them face our might, let them see what Dawi of the Angrund Clan are made of!
So predickable, dese stunties act like clockworkz. I bet I could work out when Ironhammer or Grudgebearer comb deir beardz if I wanted...
So, 'ere's da plan, take 'em in da front and in da sidez. I want da way clear'd so I can get my new prodder! Geddit?
If I see any of yoo runnin' da wrong way... well Gobbla 'ere iz' 'ungry - ee's alwayz 'ungry!
Dis false prophet don't talk to da Green Godz. I should know cos dey told me, dey don't like 'im! Ee smellz right funny. 'Ee got some crazy funk about 'im alright.
Go and kill da git and all 'iz mates. And get my mask back off 'im...
...dey nicked it and I want it back!
Black Fire Pass - it's all burnt, just 'ow I like my battlefieldz.
Gork want uz to fight da humies 'ere. Sez if we do dat and smack 'em about real good, den 'ee'll power up ma staff.
So listen to ya mate, Wurrzag - I'm da prophet and wot I sez goes! Let'z get 'em!
Um chuuka arrr, um chuuka arr, um chuuka ar Wurrzag Ud Ura Zahubu!
Right, dats Gork and Mork up-ta-date! And they're as miffed as me at dose gits stealin' my Squiggly Beast!
We gotta go and teach 'em a lesson; teach 'em not ta mess wiv Da Great Green Prophet! WAAAGH!
My friends; we are blighted by savage deception from those we once thought of as brothers! They have stolen the artefacts from beneath us and now they mock our righteous fury!
We will not yield to these curs, no! We will plunge our blades into their ignoble hearts and reclaim our birthright!
Much like the sea crashing against the shore, we will crush these traitors. Now, with me, Companions; for Bordeleaux!
It is a great deed we must do today. The twisted things of Chaos have come to our shores in vast numbers. Many were dashed upon the rocks, yet enough remain to pose a terrible threat.
Malice seeps from their every pore and breath - they are the very essence of doom.
Should they win this day, Bretonnia will be nought but ruins. But hope endures; take solace in the Lady’s shining grace - for victory!
Companions - Bretonnia's need is dire! This terrible fog corrodes our focus. Our enemy, a horde of horrifying beasts, thrives in this gloom, so be on your guard.
A head-on charge may not succeed - we must proceed more carefully. They are fast and deceptively cunning, but you are the Lady’s men, and no beast will stop you.
Should we fail today, Bretonnia will be left vulnerable. The kingdom relies on us; so fight to defend all you hold dear!
Right, yoo gitz! Fink you can hide from me in dere! Dis fortress iz now mine!
I'm 'da Greatest' not som stinking goblin-lovin' git called Rotgut! Immortulz ta me - let'z get ‘em!!!
Men of Reikland! Greenskins assault our capital. Theirs is a vile race Sigmar swore to expel from our lands, yet they dare return!
Join me, men - for I will not rest until every accursed Goblin lies burning on a pyre!
Feeble Liche - come hence from mine fortress and kneel before thy Lord!
Drakenhof's stones are bound by mortar of mine own blood. While yours shall be sprayed across the battlefield as I wrench the head from thine shoulders!
Fellow Dawi, I see Orc scum! They foul our mountains with their vile taint.
The Dammaz Kron, our Great Book of Grudges, is filled with such Greenskin atrocities! Bring hammer and axe - show these urks and grobi no mercy!
It is time for a cull, my kin, the creatures of Troll Country are nowt but a nuisance - a menace to be laid low!
To the Slayers, I say, chant your battle-hymns of doom, fulfil your oaths and seek glory in death!

To the rest of the throng: I have studied the pages of the Dammaz Kron and found many, many entries of Trolls, Giants and other fell things attacking Dwarfen families, stealing our treasures, and destroying our holds!
These creatures are descendants of those perpetrators and the debt stands with them.
Destroy these monsters, bring them down like rotten elgi trees, so we may raid their filthy lairs and reclaim lost heirlooms that belong in Karaz-a-Karak!
This is my edict as High King! Khazukan Kazakit-ha!
Behold, the stone-fruits of the Engineers' Guild's labour!
New flying Gyro-machines will take to the air!
Let me assure my traditionalist brethren within the Guild that Morgrim himself would be pleased with this innovation.
Now let us test them against the eternal enemy - the ones who have more entries in the Great Book of Grudges than any other - the Orcs!
See how the Greenskin filth flock around that vile pillar! Let us wipe them out!
So confident am I in these new machines that I forsake my axe, and will not take it up again until victory is secured here.
I do this in the knowledge that those Orcs will soon be corpses scattering the battlefield. Let us be about this!
Behold! The stone-fruits of the Engineers' Guild's labour - new flying Gyro-machines will take to the air!
Let me assure my traditionalist brethren within the Guild, that Morgrim himself would be pleased with this innovation.
